title: 'Won't play in India': Bangladesh out of T20 WC? BCB defiant despite ICC's ultimatum
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has confirmed its non-participation in the T20 World Cup, refusing to travel to India due to the Mustafizur Rahman issue and rejected venue change requests. The BCB cited security concerns and national pride, stating they will continue to fight for their position.

title: 'Running beautifully': Trump says 'Board of Peace' has started work
content: President Trump unveiled his "Board of Peace" at Davos, a $1 billion initiative aimed at resolving international conflicts.  While many nations, particularly from the Middle East, have confirmed participation, key allies like Britain have expressed doubts.  The announcement follows Trump's frustration over not receiving the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Trump unveils 'Board of Peace': India absent from stage; Pak's Shehbaz Sharif joins US Prez
content: Former US President Donald Trump launched his "Board of Peace" initiative at the World Economic Forum in Davos. India received an invitation to join this effort aimed at resolving global conflicts. However, India was not present on the stage during the unveiling. Several countries, including some from the Middle East and Asia, were listed as participants in the initiative.

title: Noida techie death case: Police arrest 2 more builders; probe widens
content: Two more builders were arrested in Noida following the tragic death of software engineer Yuvraj Mehta, whose car fell into an unbarricaded, water-filled construction pit. A harrowing video shows Mehta desperately signaling for help with his phone's torch for nearly 90 minutes as a crowd watched helplessly.

title: From Oracle to Salesforce: Marc Benioff’s note to Tony Robbins; ‘26 years ago, I chose to build my own company’
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff expressed deep gratitude to motivational speaker Tony Robbins, crediting his early programs for transforming his commute and inspiring the founding of Salesforce. Benioff highlighted the company's massive growth and its 1-1-1 philanthropy model, attributing much of this success to Robbins' influence on ambitious long-term thinking and business as a force for good.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands in the US; ‘Leader’ roles added
content: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization drive influenced by AI. The consulting giant aims to better align roles with evolving client demands and employee career aspirations. New senior leadership designations will also be introduced, promising greater clarity and market relevance across all divisions.

title: Apple enters AI wearables: AI pin with cameras, microphone and speaker in the works; what we know so far
content: Apple is reportedly developing a wearable AI pin, similar in size to an AirTag, featuring dual cameras, microphones, and a speaker. This device aims to capture and respond to its surroundings, potentially launching by 2027 to rival OpenAI's upcoming hardware. The project, however, remains in early stages and could be canceled if it doesn't meet expectations.

title: Greenland: Nato chief says talks to focus on keeping Russia, China out
content: Nato chief Mark Rutte revealed that discussions with the US concerning Greenland will prioritize blocking Russian and Chinese military or economic influence in the Danish Arctic territory. This follows President Trump's recent softening of earlier acquisition threats, indicating a "framework" for a deal has been reached.  Allies, especially Arctic members, aim to secure the region.

title: Ads in ChatGPT? Google AI CEO flags OpenAI's new experiment; terms it 'premature '
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: 'Chup chaap ball daal': Rohit Sharma's 'appeal' warning to India spinner
content: Rohit Sharma lauded Tilak Varma's composure and big-match temperament, highlighting his potential for the T20 World Cup. Sharma also humorously advised Kuldeep Yadav to focus on bowling rather than appealing excessively. Both players are crucial for India's title defense campaign.

title: Honour killing in Moradabad? Couple thrashed to death; girl's brother held
content: Bodies of a 24-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman from different communities, who had been missing for three days, were discovered in Moradabad district. Police suspect honour killing, with the woman's brothers arrested for allegedly killing the couple and burying their bodies near a temple.

title: Jharkhand’s new coaching law explained: What the Bill changes for students, parents and institutes
content: Jharkhand will regulate coaching centres under the Jharkhand Coaching Centres (Control and Regulation) Bill, 2025. The framework mandates portal-based registration and campus-wise licensing, caps operating hours, regulates advertising claims, and sets up district committees and a state authority. It also requires mental-health counsellors, student and tutor IDs, fee disclosure, refund policies, bank guarantees, and graded penalties.

title: 'It failed to take off': Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth on layoffs in division Zuckerberg renamed the company for
content: Meta is reducing its virtual reality workforce and closing studios. This move comes as VR headset sales have not met expectations. The company is reallocating resources from VR projects to focus on artificial intelligence glasses and wearable devices. This strategic shift signals a significant course correction for Meta's metaverse ambitions.

title: Ranji: Gill's return ends in a two-ball duck; Jadeja's batting woes continue
content: The Ranji Trophy clash between Punjab and Saurashtra saw senior India players Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja endure forgettable outings on a day of falling wickets. Gill was dismissed for a duck, while Jadeja managed only 7 runs. Saurashtra was bowled out for 172, with Punjab struggling at 87 for 5 by the end of Day 1.

title: MLB trade rumors: Phillies target $7.7mn Red Sox OF for 2026 shakeup
content: Philadelphia Phillies are reportedly eyeing Boston Red Sox outfielder Jarren Duran to bolster their struggling outfield for the 2026 season. Duran offers much-needed speed, defense, and consistent offense, fitting Philadelphia's immediate needs. A potential trade involving Alec Bohm and prospects could reshape both teams, addressing Philadelphia's outfield woes while providing Boston with key pieces.

title: Who is Cece? Twitch streamer at the center of Marvel Rivals Creator Cup controversy
content: Twitch streamer Cecee faced online backlash after a heated incident during a Marvel Rivals tournament.  She insulted a teammate during a live match.  Cecee later apologized, admitting her mistakes as team captain.  She stated she reacted emotionally and failed to de-escalate the situation.  The streamer promised to improve her leadership skills.

title: Patrick Mahomes quote of the day: Never lose hope in tough times
content: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: Dhurandhar OTT release: When and where to stream Ranveer Singh spy-thriller
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, continues its impressive box office run, grossing over Rs 829 crore. The action-thriller is set for a digital premiere on Netflix on January 30. This move follows a lucrative Rs 130 crore deal for streaming rights, including the sequel, highlighting the film's significant commercial appeal and Ranveer Singh's market influence.

title: 'BJP wants king's rule': Rahul Gandhi urges 'poor' to unite against VB-G RAM G Act
content: Addressing the National MGNREGA Workers’ Convention organised by the Rachnatmak Congress, Rahul Gandhi said PM Modi wants to finish the concept of Panchayati Raj and alleged that the ruling BJP wants an India "where the King decides everything". With the new law, the Centre will decide the work and allocation of funds with BJP-ruled governments always getting precedence, he said.

title: Giannis blasts Bucks after crushing loss to OKC
content: Milwaukee's season hit a new low as they were outplayed by the Oklahoma City Thunder, leading to Giannis Antetokounmpo's blunt assessment of the team's chemistry issues. He expressed frustration with players being selfish and not playing together, highlighting a lack of effort and a tendency to try and win games individually.

title: Small pockets of land, Golden Dome: Trump’s Greenland U-turn and the ‘framework deal’
content: US President Trump claims a framework deal on Arctic sovereignty and tariffs with Nato chief Rutte, sparking confusion. Denmark and Greenland deny any Nato mandate for such talks. The proposed deal involves US military bases with limited sovereignty and a missile defence system, aiming to counter Russia and China's influence.

title: 'Monkey off the back': Ashwin on Suryakumar Yadav's knock in 1st T20I vs New Zealand
content: Ravichandran Ashwin lauded Suryakumar Yadav's 22-ball 32 in the first T20I against New Zealand, calling it a crucial knock to overcome a lean patch. India secured a commanding 48-run victory, with strong performances from Abhishek Sharma and Rinku Singh, taking a 1-0 series lead.

title: SC allows Hindus, Muslims to offer prayers at MP's Bhojshala on Basant Panchami
content: The Supreme Court has permitted Hindu prayers at the Bhojshala-Kamal Maula Mosque from sunrise to sunset on Basant Panchami, while Muslims can offer namaz between 1 pm and 3 pm. The court also mandated sharing the ASI's expert report on the site's religious character with both communities.

title: From Rs 275 crore to bare bones: AIFF faces a tough test to sell ISL broadcast rights
content: The AIFF has reissued a broadcast tender for the ISL 2025–26 season after its earlier RFP failed to attract bidders. With its deal with FSDL expired, reduced production budgets, uncertain fixtures and limited bargaining power, the federation faces a tough challenge in securing a viable broadcast partner, raising concerns over revenues, broadcast quality and club finances.

title: How buying a 2nd home can open multiple business prospects: Expert insights
content: Second home buyers, particularly for tourist villas, now prioritize privacy, space, and authentic experiences over traditional asset appreciation and rental income. This shift, accelerated by the pandemic, sees villas blending real estate with hospitality, offering personalized guest experiences and becoming a lifestyle investment rather than solely an asset.

title: BMC mayoral race: Woman from general category to head richest civic body; UBT Sena condemns move
content: Mumbai's Mayor post is now reserved for a woman from the open category after a lottery conducted by the state Urban Development Department. The draw, attended by various political leaders, determines reserved positions for 29 Municipal Corporations across Maharashtra, ensuring representation by category and gender.

title: You’re 'not addicted' to screen: What is Doomscrolling and why it feels impossible to stop?
content: Late-night scrolling through distressing news, known as doomscrolling, is a stress response, not a lack of discipline. Our brains, wired for survival, interpret constant negative information as a threat, leading to anxiety and sleep issues. Understanding this helps shift focus from self-blame to managing stress and practicing digital hygiene for peace

title: Are tariffs biggest threat to Indian economy? Gita Gopinath does not think so – what she said
content: Former IMF deputy managing director Gita Gopinath highlighted pollution as a greater threat to India's economic growth than trade tariffs. She emphasized its significant human and economic costs, citing millions of deaths annually and a substantial impact on GDP. Gopinath urged for 'war footing' action to address pollution, stressing its importance for investor confidence and national development.

title: Drone attack: Russian oil port blasts, fuel tanks damaged in attack by Ukraine; 3 killed
content: A Russian oil terminal near Volna was hit late Wednesday.  The strike caused a major fire, killing at least two people and injuring several others.  Four oil product tanks caught fire.  Emergency services extinguished the blaze by Thursday morning.  This marks the second consecutive night of attacks on Krasnodar Krai.  Ukraine considers Russian energy infrastructure legitimate military targets.

title: Noida techie's death: New clip shows last-moment attempt to save Yuvraj Mehta — video
content: A chilling video captures software engineer Yuvraj Mehta's final moments, trapped in a deep, unbarricaded excavation pit after his car plunged in. For nearly 90 minutes, his phone's torch and cries for help pierced the dense fog, but rescue efforts were tragically hampered by the depth and conditions, ultimately failing to reach him in time.

title: Blast at Chhattisgarh steel plant: 6 killed, 4 injured after coal kiln explodes
content: In a tragic incident at Real Ispat & Power Ltd in Chhattisgarh, a catastrophic explosion at a coal kiln has resulted in the loss of six lives, with four more workers suffering critical injuries. The explosion occurred during a routine operation, scattering dangerous debris and prompting an extensive rescue mission as fears arise about the possibility of additional casualties.

title: India rout NZ: Abhishek Sharma fastest to 5K T20 runs — all major records
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 84 off 35 balls powered India to a record-extending 238/7 against New Zealand in the first T20I. Sharma became the fastest to 5,000 T20 runs and hit the quickest fifty by an Indian against New Zealand. Suryakumar Yadav and Rinku Singh also contributed significantly, while Arshdeep Singh continued his wicket-taking spree.

title: ‘None of our business’: Putin clears Russia’s stand on acquiring Greenland — what Moscow has said
content: Russian President Putin has said  Greenland's fate is not Moscow's concern, despite US President Trump's renewed push to wrest its control. While formally distancing Russia, Moscow appears to see opportunity in growing US-Europe discord over the strategically vital Arctic island. The assertion strains US-Denmark ties and raises questions about NATO unity.

title: Attendance alone cannot withhold exams: Delhi High Court orders DU to release law results
content: In January 2026, the Delhi High Court ordered Delhi University to release the examination results of law students previously withheld for alleged attendance shortages. The court held that attending exams granted students the right to results, stressing that attendance alone cannot block academic progression. The ruling offers relief to students and sets a precedent for fairness in higher education.

title: Trump sanctions impact: India eyes alternatives to Russian crude; taps Guyana, Saudi
content: Trump sanctions impact: Indian refiners are diversifying crude imports to offset reduced Russian supplies hit by US sanctions, stepping up purchases from Saudi Arabia and sourcing cargoes from Guyana after a two-year gap.

title: T20 WC: ICC rejects Bangladesh plea — Pakistan disappointed but won’t withdraw
content: Pakistan expressed disappointment as the International Cricket Council rejected Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches from India, despite Pakistan backing Bangladesh's stance in principle. However, Pakistan has clarified that withdrawing from the tournament is not an option, as they are already scheduled to play at a neutral venue.

title: Silver market jitters: ETFs see steep 20% drop; what’s causing the sudden drop?
content: Indian silver ETFs experienced a significant sell-off, dropping up to 20% as investors exited amid precious metal volatility. This correction erased previous premiums, with funds trading below net asset values. The sharp decline in ETFs contrasted with more modest price drops in global and domestic silver markets.

title: ‘Manual frisking’ misused: South Korean woman alleges assault at Bengaluru airport
content: A South Korean businesswoman was allegedly sexually assaulted by an airline ground-handling employee at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport. The 32-year-old woman reported being subjected to "manual frisking" by the staff member under the guise of a baggage issue. The accused, identified as Mohammed Affaann Ahmed, has been arrested and charged under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Operation Trashi-I: Day 5 sees fresh encounter in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Security forces engaged in a fresh gunfight with holed-up terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday. The ongoing "Operation Trashi-I," launched Sunday, intensified as a search team encountered a group of two to three foreign terrorists, believed to be Jaish-e-Mohammad operatives, in Singhpora's dense forests.

title: Avoid traffic jams ahead of Republic Day: Traffic restrictions, timings to know
content: Delhi Traffic Police has announced extensive road restrictions for the Republic Day parade's full dress rehearsal on January 23. Commuters are advised to use peripheral routes to avoid congestion in central Delhi, with heavy vehicle entry into Delhi and Gurugram also regulated from January 22 to January 26.

title: Faceoff in Karnataka assembly: Ruckus over VB-G RAM G bill; guv snubs speech, walks off
content: Karnataka Governor Thawarchand Gehlot walked out of the legislature after reading only two lines of his address, refusing to read cabinet-approved paragraphs critical of the Centre. This triggered a political storm, with the government accusing the BJP of influencing the Governor and the opposition alleging politicization of the address.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Mets strike again, add ace Peralta from Brewers
content: The Mets' winterlong pursuit of a front-line starting pitcher ended Wednesday with them acquiring All-Star Freddy Peralta and right-hander Tobias Myers from the Brewers for prospects Brandon Sproat and Jett Williams.

title: GM Lynch: Aiyuk has played last snap for 49ers
content: At Wednesday's end-of-season news conference, 49ers general manager John Lynch confirmed what has been obvious for months: WR Brandon Aiyuk will not return to the only NFL team he has ever known.

title: Giannis cites chemistry, selfish play after routs
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo says chemistry issues might be contributing to the Bucks' recent penchant for lopsided losses.

title: Knicks win by franchise-best 54, end 4-game skid
content: The Knicks ended their four-game losing streak Wednesday night with the most lopsided victory in franchise history, beating the Nets 120-66.

title: Stidham, Broncos keep prep as normal as possible
content: Quarterback Jarrett Stidham, set to make his first start in two years in Sunday's AFC Championship Game, and the Broncos have tried to stick to the team's usual routines.

title: Keys, Pegula advance in all-American matchups
content: In a pair of matches between American women, defending champion Madison Keys survived a challenge from Ashlyn Krueger and Jessica Pegula defeated McCartney Kessler.

title: Niners' injury probe includes looking into substation
content: Niners GM John Lynch said the team will look into "everything" to find out why injuries continue to pile up year after year, including an investigation into the viral electrical substation conspiracy theory.

title: Tucker: Dodgers' pedigree made decision 'easier'
content: Kyle Tucker was introduced by the Dodgers on Wednesday and he said the decision to pick L.A. over the Mets and Blue Jays was made easier because of the team's championship pedigree.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Biggest questions for all 30 teams at midseason
content: What are the biggest questions hovering above all 30 teams midway through the season, and where do the teams land in this week's rankings?

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: New NFL mock draft alert! Kiper projects all 32 first-round picks, including new homes for two QBs
content: Where will national title game standouts Fernando Mendoza and Akheem Mesidor land in Round 1? And could we really see six WRs in the opening 32 picks?

title: Predicting 68 starting quarterbacks for 2026
content: We're nine months from the 2026 season starting, but we're looking at every power team's QB situation.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the Olympics: Why MacKinnon is No. 1
content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

title: 'We would have a great team': What Russian NHLers are saying about missing the Olympics
content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many players.

title: Liberty, Fever among the top 2026 WNBA schedule reveals on social media
content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

title: UCL talking points: Matchday 8's must-see games, Man City's slump, more
content: What's at stake on the final matchday? Is it time to rule a line through Man City? ESPN's experts answer all the burning questions from the Champions League's penultimate group matches.

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame voting winners, losers and who could get in next
content: The results are in! Our experts break down the highs and lows of the 2026 vote and look ahead to 2027.

title: Questions on NFL draft's top 10 picks: Would the Raiders trade the No. 1 pick? Will the Chiefs go RB?
content: We're three months away from the 2026 NFL draft. What's the latest on each team picking in the top 10? Our reporters weigh in.

title: Stacking the NBA's most valuable players at 10 distinct skills: Where SGA ranks No. 1
content: Who needs the eye test? This metric shows the NBA's best players at several categories based on every line of the play-by-play.

title: Reranking men's college basketball Freshman of the Year contenders
content: Darryn Peterson has finally entered the top 10, along with two other players. Cameron Boozer remains No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Power Rankings: Iowa, Ohio State soar into top 10 -- but can they stay there?
content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: MMA Rank 50-1: Which stars could shine the brightest in 2026?
content: Makhachev, Topruia or Chimaev? ESPN ranks the top 50 fighters in MMA based on how they will perform in 2026.

title: CFP takeaways: Even as a favored Goliath, Indiana's win stands alone in sports history
content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Vinícius Júnior's future at Real Madrid: Stay, exit or run contract down?
content: Vinícius Júnior has returned to form for Real Madrid, but what should he do about his future at the club? Here are his options.

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: How to bet the American Express: Is it worth betting on Scottie Scheffler to win?
content: The second stop of the PGA Tour brings us short, scorable courses and Scottie Scheffler's first start.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea want Dortmund's Felix Nmecha
content: Dortmund midfielder Felix Nmecha is attracting interest from Manchester United and Chelsea. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Noida techie death: NGT takes suo motu cognisance; flags environmental violation
content: . With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: 12 sailors rescued from sinking Bangladeshi vessel in West Bengal river
content: Officials said they are examining whether poor visibility due to fog or a mechanical fault led to the mishap

title: Bangladesh won’t play T20 World Cup in India, vows to ‘keep fighting’
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board said ICC did not do justice by not shifting Bangladesh’s league matches to Sri Lanka

title: 'Farm Guards' deployed at Aralam to keep wild elephants away from human settlements
content: The devices, with sensors, emit loud alarm sounds and intense flashing lights when elephants approach, forcing them to retreat

title: IndiGo Q3 profit plunges 78% to ₹549.1 crore
content: In the third quarter of the current financial year, InterGlobe Aviation, the parent of IndiGo, recorded a total income of ₹24,540.6 crore, higher than ₹22,992.8 crore posted in the year-ago period

title: Twenty20 party in Kerala joins NDA
content: Sabu M. Jacob says Twenty20 has ‘eschewed its decade-old founding concept’ of giving a wide berth to coalition politics after the party faced an almost existential electoral threat from ‘an unlikely cabal’ of LDF, UDF, SDPI and Welfare Party of India in local body elections

title: Bengaluru airport ground staff arrested for sexually harassing Korean businesswoman
content: The complainant told the police that Ahmed frisked her intrusively and continued to do so despite her objections. He allegedly left after saying “thank you”.

title: Merely calling hypertension lifestyle disorder not enough to deny disability pension: Delhi HC
content: The two-judge Bench, in a judgment, states that lifestyles varied from one individual to another, and there was an obligation on the medical board to give reasons for its conclusion after duly examining the individual

title: Water crisis draining Kochi Corporation’s coffers
content: Corporation has been deploying tankers to bridge supply deficit following collapse of a water storage chamber of Kerala Water Authority at Thammanam and breakdowns at  Pazhoor pump house

title: UPC Volt to set up AI ready data centre at Telangana’s Bharat Future City; ₹5,000 crore investment over 5 years estimated
content: The facility is expected to create more than 3,000 direct & indirect jobs during construction and over 800 direct and indirect jobs during operation

title: Two more bodies retrieved from Bhadra canal in Shivamogga district of Karnataka
content: On January 18, the four persons had left their home in Arebilachi village on two bikes to wash clothes in the canal The search operation began on January 18 soon after four members of a family were reported missing

title: 10 soldiers killed as Army vehicle falls into gorge in J&K’s Doda
content: The vehicle, carrying 17 personnel, was heading towards a high-altitude post when its driver lost control and the vehicle plunged into a 200-foot-deep gorge

title: Will take up issue of MGNREGA repeal strongly during Parliament’s Budget session: Kharge
content: Addressing the National MGNREGA Workers’ Convention organised by the Rachnatmak Congress, Mr. Kharge said people must unite and not let the government implement the new law

title: NIA court sentences man to 10 years of imprisonment in Bengal's LeT recruitment module case
content: The National Investigation Agency took over the case from the West Bengal Police in April 2020 and arrested Sayyad M. Idris, along with another person

title: Sangeetha vs. Geetham: Madras High Court reserves judgment in trademark dispute
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy, however, permits the parties to attempt for an out-of-court settlement before he could pronounce orders, and inform him if it fructifies

title: Vijay’s TVK gets ‘whistle’ symbol for 2026 Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu
content: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan-led Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) was allotted the ‘battery torch’ symbol by the ECI

title: Supreme Court refuses to issue omnibus directions on stampede prevention
content: At the outset, CJI Surya Kant raised fundamental questions about the scope of judicial intervention in matters involving crowd management and law and order

title: Material procurements by DISCOMs: APERC to issue regulation or guidelines for curbing irregularities
content: APERC in-charge chairman Venkata Rama Reddy said the move would exercise greater control over procurements by DISCOMs to rid transactions of corruption

title: Annamalai University employees stage protest demanding release of arrears
content: The employees have been forced to strike as their demands have not been fulfilled despite promises by the State government, a spokesperson of the JAC said

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: Vigilance court grants one-day SIT custody of tantri Kandararu Rajeevaru
content: Rajeevaru is the 13th accused in the case. He has been shifted to SIT office in Thiruvananthapuram for interrogation

title: Frequent leopard sightings at Marayeepalayam hillock in Erode trigger panic among residents
content: On Tuesday (January 20, 2026), a leopard was seen climbing down from a boulder, causing further unrest in the area

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR updates: ECI's SIR order doesn't clearly state it is about illegal immigration, notes Bench
content: ECI's counsel states that political parties that raised suspicion about errors in the electoral rolls are now complaining when the revision is done

title: Six workers killed, five injured in blast at steel plant in Chhattisgarh
content: The incident occurred at the Real Ispat Sponge Iron Factory located in Bakulahi village in the Bhatapara rural area, a police official said

title: Reservation lottery marred by disruptions as BMC placed in open women category, instead of OBC
content: The decision triggered strong reactions, particularly as the city’s mayoral post had already been reserved for the open women category in 2017

title: Messi’s Kochi visit in March faces fresh doubts as no official announcement yet on Argentina friendly match
content: Event’s sponsor remains unable to guarantee that the team will arrive during the March window as publicised, after the originally scheduled visit on November 25 was called off

title: Supreme Court allows Hindu prayers at disputed Madhya Pradesh’s Bhojshala site on Basant Panchami
content: The Supreme Court also directed that a list of persons from the Muslim community coming for namaz be given to the district administration

title: Net FDI negative for fourth month in a row in November 2025, outflows exceed inflows by $446 million
content: Net foreign portfolio investments have also been negative so far in the financial year 2025-26, with uncertainty over the India-U.S. trade deal and the weakening rupee affecting investor confidence

title: Andhra Government to spend over ₹75 crore to renovate 57 temples in Nellore
content: Endowments Minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy plans to set up a 100-acre solar power project in the lands of Narasimha Swamy temple

title: Notice issued to singer Neha Singh Rathore in Varanasi case over remarks on PM Modi
content: Lanka police station in-charge Rajkumar Sharma said a case was registered against folk singer Neha Singh Rathore in 2025 on charges of making derogatory comments about the Prime Minister

title: Cold conditions grip Kashmir; snowfall likely
content: “There was a decrease in night temperatures at most places in Kashmir and the mercury settled below the freezing point across the valley,” officials said

title: BJP demands action against Congress MLAs over scenes after Karnataka governor’s address in House
content: Mr. Ashok alleged that Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil had attempted to “block the Governor’s way” inside the Assembly and demanded that action be taken.

title: J&K woman officer to command all-male CRPF marching contingent on Republic Day
content: Simran Bala, for the first time, will command a party of more than 140 male personnel during the annual national event

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Delhi government on plea of LeT terrorist against death penalty in 2000 Red Fort case
content: LeT terrorist Mohammad Arif was awarded the death sentence for the 2000 Red Fort attack that killed three  Army jawans

title: Fresh encounter breaks out in J&K’s Kishtwar
content: A fresh contact was established with the holed up terrorists in the dense forests of Singhpora on Thursday (January 22, 2026) morning, officials said

title: 167 drug samples flagged as ‘not of standard quality’ in December 2025: Health Ministry
content: The list of NSQ and spurious drugs is put up on the CDSCO portal on a monthly basis as part of routine regulatory surveillance activity

title: Noida techie death: Fresh FIR against builders for flouting environment pollution laws
content: The FIR has been lodged even as a Special Investigation Team (SIT) formed by the Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday (January 22, 2026) continued its probe into the matter on the third day

title: Karnataka Governor Gehlot reads just two lines of his address in Legislature session, CM calls it ‘violation of Constitution’
content: This is the third face-off between a governor and a state government in the past two days in non BJP-ruled states.

title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots: Delhi court acquits Sajjan Kumar in Vikaspuri, Janakpuri violence case
content: In August 2023, a court had charged Sajjan Kumar with rioting and promoting enmity, while discharging him of murder and criminal conspiracy offences

title: Can Bharathapuzha river in Kerala survive Maha Magha, dubbed ‘Kumbh of the South’?
content: The days leading up to the inauguration of its modern ode have been punctuated with religio-political tensions. Yet, beneath the spiritual, cultural, and political contestations lies a more pressing concern: How will the already fragile Bharathapuzha sustain a recurring Kumbh-scale event?

title: 15 Maoists killed in gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand’s West Singhbhum district, say Police
content: The exchange of gunfire between security forces and Maoists began in the Saranda forest of the West Singhbhum district of the State

title: Kerala Assembly adjourned amid uproar over Sabarimala gold theft controversy
content: Opposition seeks resignation of Devaswom Minister V.N. Vasavan and expulsion of Travancore Devaswom Board president

title: Amruta Fadnavis hits back at Sanjay Raut, says ‘my husband in Davos not for picnic’
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis is in Davos to participate in the World Economic Forum annual meeting

title: Watch: The Hindu Editorial | Meaningless formality: On Governors, their actions
content: The actions of the Tamil Nadu and Kerala Governors during their Assembly addresses on January 20 have triggered a fresh constitutional debate. Chief Ministers accused the Governors of skipping, altering or refusing to read Cabinet-approved speeches, violating long-standing conventions.

title: Kerala prisoners’ wage hike draws fire; government defends move
content: Decision draws flak particularly since it comes in run-up to Assembly elections. Critics highlight disparity of wages provided to workers in other sectors

title: First ‘Made in India’ C-295 aircraft expected to roll out of factory before September: Jaishankar
content: In his remarks at a meeting with Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares, Mr. Jaishankar asserted that the world must display “zero tolerance” towards terrorism

title: Bengaluru hospital performs combined robotic heart bypass and prostate cancer surgery in a single operative session
content: Although combining two major surgeries under a single anaesthesia is rare, in this case, it significantly helped avoid multiple major surgeries and hospital admissions, repeated exposure to anaesthesia, prolonged recovery and high risk

title: India ‘stopped’ buying oil from Russia, claims U.S. Treasury Secretary
content: “India started buying Russian oil after the (Ukraine) conflict began, but President Trump put a 25% tariff on them, and India has geared down and has stopped buying Russian oil,” says Mr. Bessent

title: Essential to forge alliance with Left, Congress at the earliest to defeat Trinamool, BJP, says Nawshad Siddique
content: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) led Left Front, Congress and ISF had forged an alliance with the ISF in the 2021 Assembly polls but the alliance did not result in much electoral success

title: Should corruption charges need prior sanction? | Explained
content: What does Section 17A of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 mandate? Why was there a split verdict on deciding whether Section 17A was constitutionally valid? What do earlier rulings by the Supreme Court state? What are the systemic reforms needed to tackle corruption among public officials?

title: A fight over figures: the constitutional debate over numerals
content: A forgotten but fiery debate in the Constituent Assembly once pitted cultural pride against pragmatic modernity over something as simple as numerals. This controversy reminds us how even digits became symbols of identity and plurality

title: Three charred to death in bus accident in Nandyal district
content: There were nearly 36 passengers in the bus at the time of accident and some of them suffered injuries

title: Tiger from Telangana enters Eluru District; Forest Department on high alert
content: The pugmarks indicate the tiger may be retracing its route back toward Telangana through which it entered the district

title: IPE-The Hindu FIC college quiz in Hyderabad on January 27
content: The Hyderabad event will be held at Sundarayya Vignana Kendram, Bagh Lingampally and quiz is open and free for all undergraduate students below the age of 28

title: Revanth-led delegation successfully convinces investors at WEF meet, explaining Telangana’s proactive policies
content: Telangana Chief Minister pitches for investments on the strength of roadmap for realising US $ 3 trillion economy

title: Minister urges coordination for timely Ramzan arrangements
content: Mr. Azharuddin was chairing a review meeting with district minorities welfare officers on Wednesday where he underscored the need for Ramzan preparations

title: Caste survey report before Feb. 10, says Minister
content: Tangadagi claimed that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had responded to the needs of the communities, and has released ₹1,600 crore to all development corporations

title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan to coach BJP-JD(S) on new job scheme
content: Sources in the BJP said that the party State leadership had requested the Centre to depute Mr. Chouhan to Karnataka to provide orientation to the Opposition members

title: India, E.U. agree to sign security and defence partnership next week: Kaja Kallas
content: Kallas noted that the E.U. is among India’s largest trading partners and described India as “indispensable” to Europe’s economic resilience

title: Ladki Bahin scheme: 1.57 crore continue to receive aid; 86 lakh beneficiaries dropped
content: Maharashtra government announced to carry out physical verification of over 24 lakhs rejected beneficiaries

title: Odisha to conduct polls for 24 new civic bodies in June end
content: State Election Commissioner Madhusudan Padhi on Wednesday (January 21, 2026) said it was mandatory to complete the electoral process within six months of the declaration of any municipal area

title: Rajasthan approves draft Bill to restrict property transfer in ‘disturbed areas’ to address communal tension
content: Law Minister Jogaram Patel said after the Cabinet meeting in Jaipur that the areas affected by violence, mob unrest, or “improper clustering” — with a change in demographic profile — could be declared as disturbed

title: Naidu proposes Israel Industrial Park and Dubai Food Cluster in A.P.
content: The Chief Minister meets several key leaders from Israel, UAE and Switzerland, seeking investment tie-ups with Andhra Pradesh

title: Camps will be organised at block and panchayat level once a month to give ‘life certificate’: Bihar Minister
content: Beneficiaries’ number under Social Security Pension Scheme increased to 1.16 crore in 2025 from 12 lakh in 2005

title: Trump Unveils Board Of Peace On Gaza, Which Has Pak Among Members
content: US President Donald Trump formally announced the first charter of his 'Board of Peace', which is a body for resolving international conflicts and has a $1 billion price tag for permanent membership.

title: 'Has He Ever Made Tea? Drama For Votes': M Kharge's "Chaiwala" Jab At PM
content: In a remark that is sure to spark a massive political row, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge has said Prime Minister Narendra Modi falsely claims he was a "chaiwala" (tea seller) just to get votes.

title: 10 Army Personnel Killed, 10 Injured As Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In J&K's Doda
content: Ten army personnel were killed and ten others injured when their vehicle skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda on Thursday, officials said.

title: Wounded Ukrainian Veterans Find Healing On Stage
content: Like the other veterans in his Kyiv-based group of around 15 actors, Ukrainian soldier Onopriienko has found healing and fulfilmenton stage.

title: Millions In US Brace For Potentially Catastrophic Ice Storm: What To Know By Numbers
content: Millions of Americans from New Mexico to the Carolinas are bracing for a potentially catastrophic ice storm that could crush trees and power lines and knock out power for days.

title: "Kutta Nahi Hu": Flier's Big Allegation Against Crew. What Air India Said
content: An incident on an international Air India flight has raised serious questions about passenger rights, with a passenger alleging misconduct by the crew after he asked for a non-vegetarian meal that he had pre-ordered.

title: Ecuador Announces Trump-style Tariffs On Colombia Over Drugs
content: Ecuador's President Daniel Noboa announced 30 percent tariffs on imports from Colombia, accusing its neighbor of failing to help fight drug cartels.

title: 'Too Dangerous To Go To Hospital': Glimpse Into Iran's Protest Crackdown
content: Young protesters shot in the back, shotgun pellets fired in a doctor's face, wounded people afraid to go to hospital: "Every family has been affected" by the deadly crackdown on Iran's recent wave of demonstrations.

title: US Set To Officially Quit World Health Organisation
content: The US is due to officially exit the World Health Organisation on Thursday, in the face of warnings it will hit both US health and global health

title: Afghan Resistance Museum Gets Revamp Under Taliban Rule
content: An Afghan who fought against Soviet forces still visits a museum celebrating the resistance, but, in keeping with rules by the Taliban authorities, the displays have undergone notable changes recently.

title: 'Not Dilli, Not Pindi': Tarique Rahman Begins Campaigning With 'Bangladesh First Agenda
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Chairman Tarique Rahman has officially kicked off his party's election campaign for the February 12 elections with a rally at Alia Madrasa ground in Sylhet-- some 242 kilometres from Dhaka.

title: "The Real Question Is...": Akhilesh Yadav On Noida Engineer's 'Party' Video
content: Amid the online chatter over a purported video of Noida techie Yuvraj Mehta hours before he drowned in a ditch, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has said the question is not whether he was returning from a party, but why he could not be saved

title: Gujarat Maritime Board Officer Shoots Wife, Then Dies By Suicide
content: A man shot his wife and later died by suicide inside their apartment in Ahmedabad. According to the police, the couple had been married for only two months.

title: AI Stock Surge An Unlikely Boon For Japan Toilet Maker
content: Shares in Japanese toilet maker Toto, known for its high-tech bidet thrones, closed nearly 10 percent higher Thursday thanks to the company's unlikely link to the semiconductor supply chain.

title: Denmark To Discuss Arctic Security, Seeks Respect For Territorial Integrity
content: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said that Denmark and Greenland will continue to engage in a constructive dialogue on security in the Arctic, provided that this is done with respect for her country's territorial integrity.

title: "Consensual Relationship Turning Sour Cannot Be Termed As Rape": Delhi Court
content: Observing that "a consensual relationship turning sour cannot be retrospectively branded as rape", the Delhi High Court has quashed an FIR alleging rape and caste-based atrocity

title: US Envoy Steve Witkoff Says Ukraine Peace Talks Down To One Issue
content: US envoy Steve Witkoff said "a lot of progress" had been made in Ukraine peace talks and that negotiations were down to one last issue.

title: Union Budget 2026: 10 Key Points For Beginners
content: The Union Budget is the annual financial plan of the government, which serves as a blueprint for the fiscal year.

title: Suspended Telangana Officer Raided, Assets Worth Over Rs 7 Crore Seized
content: The book value of assets identified so far is estimated at Rs 7.69 crore. However, according to the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), Telangana, the market value of seized assets is over Rs 50 crore.

title: Man Utd, Chelsea sneak through: What we learned from the League Cup semis
content: arsenal beat 10-player arsenal 1-0 to reach their first league cup final . despite being reigning european title holders, arsenal have squandered their first chance at claiming silverware . man city have ratcheted up the pressure on the title race .

title: Midseason debate: Is OKC in trouble? Can the Clippers really climb in the West?
content: defending champs are vulnerable, who's lurking as surprise contenders? what's wrong with Paolo Banchero? the Oklahoma City Thunder 's slide from the 76ers to the san francisco bulldogs . defending champions donovan Mitchell scores 35 points with nine assists .

title: Can Kenneth Walker III carry Seahawks to Super Bowl after Zach Charbonnet's injury?
content: Seahawks running back Zach Charbonnet missed the rest of the playoffs with a knee injury . the seahawks might not be hosting the game at Lumen Field as the conference's top seed . a successful try tied the score at 30-30 .

title: 10 must-see WNBA games for the 2026 season
content: the WNBA released its 2026 regular-season schedule on friday . the league will tip off its 30th season on may 8 . at the top of the list is a new CBA . a moratorium on league business as negotiations continue .

title: How to reach the UCL knockouts: Can Chelsea, Barça avoid the playoff round?
content: the knockout rounds of the 2025-26 UEFA champions league are fast approaching . the final matchweek of the league phase must be played, and the stakes could hardly be higher for some of the continent's biggest clubs . liverpool , barcelona , chelsea and manchester city also competing for top eight spots .

title: NFL execs predict 2026 moves: Lamar Jackson, A.J. Brown trades coming?
content: the Ravens' cap hit looms next season . it's like the draft -- hitting on 40-50% of first-round picks is very hard to do . the possibilities are limitless: free agency signings, retirements, contenders and pretenders .

title: Buffalo fired Sean McDermott, but there's more blame to go around
content: no bad team in NFL history has ever won the Super Bowl . there's more than one good team in football every season, so luck and injuries get involved down the stretch . the bills are only the sixth team in the super Bowl era to string together seven-plus seasons of double-digit wins .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: the Hoosiers are the first team to go 16-0 in a season in the modern era . the top five is full of familiar names: Indiana, Notre Dame, no. 4 Georgia and no. 5 Oregon .

title: 💯 Arizona high schooler breaks scoring record
content: Adrian Stubbs needed just three quarters to drop 100 points in 109-25 victory at Yuma Kofa . the 5-foot-10 guard broke the previous record of 75 points held by George McCormick since 1966 . he's not on a short list for can't-miss NIL targets for major companies .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mets get their ace in blockbuster deal for Peralta
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . Bradford Doolittle and David Schoenfield will evaluate each move as it happens, so check back in for the freshest analysis through the start of spring training .
